content: Hey @T-compiler ! I am trying to organize a meeting I call the Cross Team Collaboration Fun Times (CTCFT). The idea is to help create a venue for teams to float ideas to one another, talk about things that affect the project, and generally have more collaboration and, well, fun. It would be a video call that would be recorded. I'd love to get feedback on the idea but also on possible recent events and agenda items. I'm looking to organize the first meeting in May.

@pnkfelix and @Wesley Wiser -- I have a question. If you were going to have some work item on the first CTCFT agenda, would you prefer the compiler team contributor guiding principles, or a retrospective on the compiler team sprint?
I'm looking for things that may inspire other teams
To either do similar things or to try other experiments
hmm. Well, I wouldn’t want the compiler contributor guiding principles on the agenda before the team itself takes the time to talk about it. But we have that time scheduled, for this friday
so in theory either should be fine
Either thing could lead to a lively conversation
in my gut, I think the Guiding Principles doc might lead itself to more bikeshedding rather than useful on-the-fly discussion (we may get a preview of that at the T-compiler meeting this friday)
while I think discussing the sprint is more likely to yield discussion of what we all might do differently
@Wesley Wiser I guess I’m talking myself into thinking that the sprint retrospective is a better topic for the first CTCFT. What do you think?
@pnkfelix I think the guiding principles might be more interesting to talk about personally but I think either could have interesting conversation.
I think revisiting after the meeting tomorrow sounds nice
One of the two would I think be a good fit
@nikomatsakis the meeting tomorrow, or the meeting friday?
@pnkfelix i meant Friday, sorry. That said, I personally kind of think the sprint would be a better choice regardless.
